composer.biography: Antonio Vivaldi (1678-1741) was an Italian Baroque composer, virtuoso violinist, teacher, and Catholic priest. Born in Venice, he was ordained in 1703 but ceased celebrating Mass shortly after due to health reasons. Vivaldi spent most of his career at the Ospedale della Pietà, a home for abandoned children where he taught violin and composed music for the all-female music ensemble. He is recognized as one of the greatest Baroque composers, known particularly for his concertos. His most famous work, The Four Seasons, is among the most popular pieces of Baroque music. Vivaldi composed over 500 concertos, along with numerous operas, sacred choral works, and chamber music. His music was highly influential on Johann Sebastian Bach and other composers. Despite his fame during his lifetime, Vivaldi died in poverty in Vienna in 1741 and was largely forgotten until the 20th century revival of interest in Baroque music.
keyContributions: Virtuoso violinist who revolutionized the concerto form
Composed The Four Seasons, one of the most popular classical works
Pioneer of programmatic music with descriptive concertos
Influenced J.S. Bach and the development of instrumental music
Master of the ritornello form in concertos

concertos.name: Concertos
concertos.description: Vivaldi composed over 500 concertos, primarily for violin but also for other instruments. These works established the three-movement fast-slow-fast structure and ritornello form that became standard.

subcategories.strings: Concertos for cello, viola d'amore, multiple violins
subcategories.winds: Concertos for bassoon, oboe, flute, recorder

sacred.name: Sacred Vocal Music
sacred.description: Sacred choral works composed primarily for the Ospedale della Pietà, including masses, motets, oratorios, and psalm settings.

operas.name: Operas
operas.description: Vivaldi composed nearly 50 operas, most now lost. These works were popular in Venice and across Europe during his lifetime.
operas.note: Only about 20 operas survive in complete or near-complete form

chamber.name: Chamber Music
chamber.description: Sonatas, trio sonatas, and other chamber works for small ensembles.

orchestral.name: Orchestral Works
orchestral.description: Sinfonias and other orchestral compositions without soloists.

works.title: Violin Concerto in E major, Op. 8 No. 1 'Spring' (La Primavera)
works.description: The first concerto of The Four Seasons, depicting springtime with bird calls, flowing streams, and a thunderstorm. Each movement is accompanied by a sonnet describing the scenes.
movements_detail: Allegro - Springtime arrives with bird songs
Largo e pianissimo sempre - The goatherd sleeps
Allegro pastorale - Nymphs and shepherds dance

works.title: Violin Concerto in G minor, Op. 8 No. 2 'Summer' (L'Estate)
works.description: The second concerto depicts the heat and storms of summer, with languid melodies contrasting with violent weather effects.
movements_detail: Allegro non molto - The heat of summer
Adagio e piano - Presto e forte - Fear of storms

works.title: Violin Concerto in F major, Op. 8 No. 3 'Autumn' (L'Autunno)
works.description: Celebrating the harvest with peasant dances and a hunting scene. The final movement depicts a dramatic hunt.
movements_detail: Allegro - Peasants celebrate the harvest with dance and song

works.title: Violin Concerto in F minor, Op. 8 No. 4 'Winter' (L'Inverno)
works.description: The final concerto portrays the bitter cold of winter, chattering teeth, and people seeking warmth by the fire.
movements_detail: Allegro non molto - Shivering in the cold snow
Largo - By the fire while rain outside
Allegro - Walking on ice and falling

works.title: Gloria in D major
works.instrumentation: Soprano solo, SATB chorus, oboe, trumpet, strings, continuo
works.description: One of Vivaldi's most famous sacred works, featuring brilliant vocal writing and festive orchestration. Composed for the Ospedale della Pietà.
movements_detail: Domine Deus, Agnus Dei (Alto and chorus)

works.title: Gloria in D major (Alternative setting)
works.description: An earlier Gloria setting, less well-known than RV 589 but equally impressive.

works.title: Magnificat in G minor
works.instrumentation: SATB soloists, SATB chorus, strings, continuo
works.description: A dramatic setting of the Magnificat text with virtuosic vocal writing and expressive harmonies.

works.title: Violin Concerto in D major, Op. 3 No. 9
works.description: From the influential L'estro armonico collection, this concerto was transcribed for organ by J.S. Bach (BWV 594).

works.title: Concerto for Strings in C major
works.description: A concerto for string ensemble without solo violin, demonstrating Vivaldi's orchestral writing.

works.title: Violin Concerto in G minor 'Summer' (from Il cimento)
works.description: A different summer-themed concerto from Il cimento dell'armonia e dell'inventione.

works.title: Violin Concerto in A minor, Op. 3 No. 6
works.description: Another famous concerto from L'estro armonico, transcribed by Bach for harpsichord (BWV 596).

works.title: Violin Concerto in A minor, Op. 4 No. 4
Dixit Dominus in D major
works.instrumentation: SATB soloists, double chorus, strings, continuo
works.description: A grand setting of Psalm 110 with double chorus, showing Vivaldi's mastery of large-scale choral writing.

works.title: Stabat Mater in F minor
works.description: A deeply expressive solo motet depicting Mary's sorrow at the cross. One of Vivaldi's most moving sacred works.

works.title: Nisi Dominus in G minor
works.description: A setting of Psalm 127 featuring virtuosic alto solos, particularly the famous 'Cum dederit' movement.

works.title: Bassoon Concerto in E minor
works.description: One of 39 bassoon concertos, demonstrating Vivaldi's skill in writing for wind instruments.

works.title: Flute Concerto in D major 'Il Gardellino' (The Goldfinch), Op. 10 No. 3
works.description: A charming flute concerto imitating the song of a goldfinch, from the set of six flute concertos Op. 10.

works.title: Flute Concerto in G minor 'La Notte' (The Night), Op. 10 No. 2
works.description: A programmatic concerto depicting nighttime scenes including sleep and dreams.

works.title: Concerto for Violin and Organ in D minor
works.instrumentation: Solo violin, solo organ, strings, continuo
works.description: A unique double concerto combining violin and organ soloists.

works.title: Concerto grosso in D minor, Op. 3 No. 11
works.description: A concerto grosso with multiple soloists, transcribed by Bach.

works.title: Concerto for Two Violins in D minor, Op. 3 No. 11
works.description: A double violin concerto with brilliant dialogue between soloists.

works.title: Concerto for Oboe in C major
works.description: One of several oboe concertos showcasing the instrument's lyrical qualities.

works.title: Concerto for Two Mandolins in G major
works.description: A charming and popular concerto for two mandolins, demonstrating Vivaldi's versatility.

works.title: Concerto for Violin and Two Cellos in C major
works.instrumentation: Solo violin, two cellos, strings, continuo
works.description: An unusual combination featuring dialogue between violin and two cellos.

works.title: Sonata for Violin and Continuo in D major, Op. 2 No. 12 'La Follia'
works.description: A set of variations on the famous 'La Folia' theme, demonstrating virtuosic violin technique.

works.title: Sinfonia in B minor 'Al Santo Sepolcro'
works.description: A somber orchestral work depicting the Holy Sepulchre, used as an introduction to sacred works.

works.title: Sinfonia in C major
works.description: A festive orchestral sinfonia in three movements.

works.title: Kyrie in G minor
works.description: A brief but expressive setting of the Kyrie text.

works.title: Lauda Jerusalem in E major
works.description: A joyful setting of Psalm 147 with festive orchestration.

works.title: Nulla in mundo pax sincera (Motet)
works.description: One of Vivaldi's most beautiful motets, featuring a lyrical soprano solo. The opening aria is particularly famous.

works.title: Orlando furioso (Opera)
works.description: An opera based on Ariosto's epic poem, one of Vivaldi's most successful operatic works.

works.title: L'Olimpiade (Opera)
works.description: An opera based on Metastasio's libretto, featuring elaborate arias and ensemble numbers.

works.title: La Griselda (Opera)
works.description: One of Vivaldi's later operas, telling the story of the patient Griselda.

ilCimento.title: Il cimento dell'armonia e dell'inventione (The Contest between Harmony and Invention)
ilCimento.description: A collection of 12 violin concertos including The Four Seasons (Nos. 1-4). The collection demonstrates Vivaldi's mastery of both programmatic and abstract concerto writing.

estroArmonico.title: L'estro armonico (Harmonic Inspiration)
estroArmonico.description: A groundbreaking collection of 12 concertos that established the Italian concerto style across Europe. Many were transcribed by J.S. Bach.

laStravaganza.title: La stravaganza (The Extravagance)
laStravaganza.description: Twelve violin concertos dedicated to Venetian nobleman Vettor Delfin, showcasing Vivaldi's virtuosic writing.
